name: Mount Lincoln

trails_config.name: Franconia Ridge Loop (via Falling Waters)
trails_config.description: Part of the classic Franconia Ridge Loop, the climb to Lincoln via Falling Waters passes multiple waterfalls and leads to an exposed ridgeline hike. The summit offers dramatic views of the Pemigewasset Wilderness, with a continuous alpine traverse to Lafayette.
trails_config.parking_info: Lafayette Place Parking, I-93 Franconia Notch

current_conditions.ai_summary: One of New Hampshire's premier peaks, Mount Lincoln rises to 5089 feet. It is known for its rugged terrain and panoramic vistas.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 5089 feet, Mount Lincoln is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its rugged and challenging terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Franconia Ridge Loop (via Falling Waters)**, a **8.6 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **NH48 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **Mount Lafayette**, which is just 0.9 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.

logistics.parking_info: Lafayette Place Parking, I-93 Franconia Notch
